title: CIA names email of around Feb. 5, 2025 (Office of Personnel Management)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The widely reported unclassified email(s) sent to OPM containing the first name and last initial of recent CIA hires.

See e.g.:
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/02/05/us/politics/cia-names-list.html
https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/05/politics/cia-sends-white-house-unclassified-email-names/index.html

Please provide these records in native electronic EML format, with all metadata such as email headers preserved. If you claim any part of a responsive record is exempt, please use blackout redaction without rasterization, and please provide ALL nonexempt parts, no matter how trivial (including e.g. literally every email header, punctuation mark, space, length, etc. that is not specifically exempt).

Please note that this request is made under FOIA only, not under the Privacy Act, and no Privacy Act waiver will be provided.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sai

title: Open Records Request Re: Unclaimed Property Database & Redactions in Address Line 1

communications.communication:
Hi,

This is a Texas Public Information Act request for records regarding the unclaimed property funds. Specifically, I'm requesting records/a procedure manual? on how the records are loaded into your system and records on how you redact out the address_line_1 in this database. I am also asking for any reports on the number of social security numbers found in the field/column address_line_1. 

My understanding is this is redacted out via a software program that is checking for sensitive information such as social security numbers. The reason I'm asking for this information is to see if there is any human review over this data redaction. 

I was reviewing the January unclaimed property database and there were 26,164,756 unique property IDs. 3,144,883 had redacted addresses. 12% of the addresses in the unclaimed property database were redacted. 

This database represents billions of dollars of unclaimed funds to the public. If 10% of the addresses are being redacted unnecessarily (and could potentially be fixed with a small process change) I believe this represents a barrier in individuals finding and claiming unclaimed funds and is reducing the amount of funds claimed by the public. As such, I believe this request is in the public interest and am requesting a fee waiver. 

Since I believe this request to be in the public interest, please note I am requesting this via Muckrock and the records will be publicly available. 

Thank you, 

John Ricker

title: OPM - Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending Women (U.S. Department Of Agriculture)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background: 

On January 29, 2025, Charles Ezell, Acting Director, U.S. Office of Personnel Management, sent a memo to all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies entitled "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending Women." Amongst other things, the memo instructed all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies to prepare two reports to be sent to  defendingwomen@opm.gov by February 7, 2025 at 12:00pm Eastern.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the complete list of actions taken in response to OPM's January 29, 2025 memo entitled: "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending
Women" and the President's Executive Order entitled "Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government "

2. A copy of any agency plans to fully comply with OPM's January 29, 2025 memo entitled: "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending
Women" and the President's Executive Order entitled "Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government "


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background: 

On January 29, 2025, Charles Ezell, Acting Director, U.S. Office of Personnel Management, sent a memo to all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies entitled "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending Women." Amongst other things, the memo instructed all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies to prepare two reports to be sent to  defendingwomen@opm.gov by February 7, 2025 at 12:00pm Eastern.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the complete list of actions taken in response to OPM's January 29, 2025 memo entitled: "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending
Women" and the President's Executive Order entitled "Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government "

2. A copy of any agency plans to fully comply with OPM's January 29, 2025 memo entitled: "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending
Women" and the President's Executive Order entitled "Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government "


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

title: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) Office for Civil Rights (OCR) / MEDEIROS (Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request

Date: February 7, 2025

To:
U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS)
Office for Civil Rights (OCR)
ATTN: FOIA Officer
JFK Federal Building, Room 1875
Boston, MA 02203
Fax: (617) 565-3809

Subject: FOIA Request for All Records Related to OCR Transaction No. 01-25-595812
Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I am requesting copies of all records, communications, internal memos, and related documents associated with the review and closure of my civil rights complaint filed with the U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) Office for Civil Rights (OCR), Transaction No. 01-25-595812.

1. Scope of Request
I am specifically requesting:

All internal communications (emails, memos, notes, reports, and case evaluations) related to OCR’s review and determination of my complaint.
All correspondence between OCR staff, including but not limited to Laurie Senat, Barbara C. Stampul, Pam Bindi, and any other officials involved in the case review and closure.
Any legal analyses or justifications used to support the decision to close my complaint without further investigation.
All case file documentation, including investigative records, reports, and any documents submitted by third parties.
Records of any communications or directives from HHS leadership regarding how complaints such as mine are handled or prioritized.

2. Request for Expedited Processing
Given the civil rights implications of this case, I request expedited processing under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E). The release of these records is in the public interest, as it pertains to the enforcement of federal civil rights laws, ADA compliance, and government transparency regarding critical healthcare and human services protections.

3. Request for Fee Waiver
I request a fee waiver pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii), as the requested information is sought in the public interest and is not for commercial use. The requested records will contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations, civil rights enforcement, and HHS compliance practices.

4. Format of Response
I request that responsive records be provided electronically in PDF format via email or secure digital link. If any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed index justifying each exemption under Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

5. Legal Obligation to Respond
Per 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i), you are required to respond to this request within 20 business days. If you require additional time, please provide a detailed written explanation for the delay.


Failure to comply with this request in a timely manner may result in further legal and administrative action to enforce compliance with FOIA. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
Whistleblower & Advocate for Constitutional Rights

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

title: Flock Damage Costs (Chicago Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am asking for records related to the replacement, relocation, and repair of ALPR cameras. 

Please include copies of invoices related to the replacement, relocation, and repair of ALPR cameras and related accessories. Copies should be in .csv format if possible, otherwise related in digital form. 

Include locations of the reinstalled or fixed ALPRs. 

Please search 2019 to today's date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Vehicle registration records for license plate 43440U from 1980 until 1983

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Vehicle registration records for license plate 43440U from 1980 until 1983
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Vehicle registration records from January 1, 1980 until January 1, 1983, for tag number: 43440U

I need the records of the vehicle with license plate 43440U in Pennsylvania because I need to establish to whom the vehicle was registered throughout the year of 1982. Such records should include the vehicle description, the name(s) of the owner(s) of the vehicle, the registration plate number, and any addresses associated with the owner(s) of the vehicle.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Rabbi Mordecai Eliyahu FBI File

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Rabbi Mordecai Eliyahu FBI File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to Mordechai Eliyahu AKA  MORDECAI ELIYAHU, whose death has been widely reported. https://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/rabbi-mordechai-eliyahu-israel-rsquo-s-sephardi-chief-rabbi-who-was-orthodox-in-his-religion-and-radical-in-his-politics-2027760.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names and companies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Public Records Request for Body Cam Footage – Deltona Middle School Arrest

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request for Body Cam Footage – Deltona Middle School Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all available body camera footage related to the arrest of Jorge Rivera and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino at Deltona Middle School on November 19, 2024.

To assist in locating the footage, here are the details of the incident:

- Date of Event: November 19, 2024
- Location: Deltona Middle School, Deltona, Florida
- Arresting Agency: Volusia County Sheriff’s Office
- Involved Deputy: School Resource Officer (female deputy)
Suspects:
- Jorge Rivera (46 years old)
- Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino (45 years old)
Incident Description:
-  The parents arrived at Deltona Middle School to protest their son being charged with battery for pushing a classmate.
- Jorge Rivera allegedly became irate during the meeting with the school resource officer, yelling insults and refusing to leave when asked.
- While in the school hallway, Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino allegedly shoved the officer, and Jorge Rivera then punched the officer in the face.
- The officer attempted to use a Taser but was knocked to the ground during the altercation.
- Jorge Rivera allegedly took the officer’s Taser before both suspects were subdued and arrested.
- The deputy sustained a concussion and was treated at a hospital.
Charges:
- Battery on a law enforcement officer
- Resisting with violence
- Disruption of a school function
- Trespassing on school grounds
- Armed robbery and grand theft (Jorge Rivera only, for taking the deputy’s Taser)
I am requesting any body camera footage related to this incident, including:

1. The initial interaction between the deputy and the parents inside the school.
2. The altercation in the hallway and subsequent struggle.
3. The arrest and any relevant post-arrest footage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: paragon

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: paragon
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The requested records are those, for the period between January 1, 2022 and the date on which this request is processed, describing and relating to the relationship between this agency and Paragon Solutions and any relationships between any representative of either entity.
Responsive records include, but are not limited to, documents concerning or mentioning Paragon Solutions and any representative thereof, including all documentation regarding its Graphite platform and any other service or software provided by or created by Paragon Solutions. These include, but are not limited to, the following:
CONTRACT AND AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, memorandums of understanding, and any other written agreements between this agency and Paragon Solutions, including all associated amendments, exhibits, and supplemental and supporting documentation. More information about the contract in question can be found here: https://www.usaspending.gov/award/CONT_AWD_70CTD024P00000012_7012_-NONE-_-NONE-. 
FINANCIAL MATERIALS
• All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the relationship between the aforementioned entities. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format. This also includes any Requests for Proposal and bidding materials provided by Paragon Solutions and any other entities responding to the same Request for Proposal or equivalent procurement request.
DOCUMENTATION OF USE
• Any logs of use and other data obtained from the Paragon Solutions platform. Should query logs exist for any other platform, service, or software created and/or provided by Paragon Solutions, these materials are also responsive to this request.
• Any audits and reports of audits of use of Paragon Solutions platforms

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cooper Quintin

communications.communication:
Dear Ed Burton: 
The UC Irvine Public Records Office (PRO) received your request on 2/6/2025 and gave it the reference number R008721-020625 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: "To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1 — any databases and/or spreadsheets used to track requests under the California Public Records Act from January 1, 2024 to the date of this request.
2 — any and all policy documents, manuals, memos and/or reports regarding the processing of public records requests from January 1, 2024 to the date of this request.

In the regard to the database requested in paragraph 1, please provide the database in its original electronic format pursuant to Cal. Gov. Code § 6253.9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ed Burton
